abstract: Consent order signed by Fiat Chrysler and government officials in wake of company's admission of widespread violations of safety laws includes novel actions in government efforts to curb such violations; measures include requirement that Fiat buy back hundreds of thousands of defective vehicles and pay customers $100 just to participate in recall of Jeeps.
lead_paragraph: The automaker could pay up to $105 million in addition to giving authority to an independent safety monitor, buying back defective vehicles and paying consumers to participate in a Jeep recall.

headline.main: Big Fine for Fiat Chrysler, Then Further Penalties to Set Example for Industry
headline.print_headline: Big Fine for Fiat Chrysler, Then Further Penalties to Set Example for Industry

snippet: The automaker could pay up to $105 million in addition to giving authority to an independent safety monitor, buying back defective vehicles and paying consumers to participate in a Jeep recall.
